Issues.Title: Feature: new WPF style for Windows 10
Issues.Body:
The WPF style now used on Windows 10 doesn't match the legacy controls, which is created by WinForms. Here is a screenshot to compare some of them:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37586447/62183882-73245680-b38e-11e9-9975-84a097a38be2.png)

I suggest we should write a set of new style to match Windows 10 WinForms style, and also another new style for dark mode in Windows 10.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Feature: new WPF style for Windows 10" (#1485)

Issues.Title: MSBuilds fail from BC2012 error.. Can't open file for writing: Access to the path … is denied.
Issues.Body:
VSF_TYPE_MARKDOWNI’ve put up with this error for over a year now because I couldn’t fix it but I could work around it. However, now that the error is happening on the Build Server it is essential that I get a remedy. There are a lot of discussions on the forums about this, including mine. None of the recommended solutions have worked for me.

What happens is that when I run a clean-and-build or a rebuild the error happens. However, a subsequent build will work. That’s how I worked around it all that time; I just pressed Ctrl-Shift-B over and over until all the offending errors went away. I can’t do that repetitive build scheme on the build server, so this needs to be addressed.

It only happens with projects that contain xaml files, but not all projects that contain xaml files are affected. It may be due to the first pass of the markup compiler locking the DLL such that the second pass can’t unlock it. There seems to be a correspondence between projects that produce a [[name]_[random]_wpftmp.[proj]](https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/210156/msbuild-is-adding-a-random-hash-and-wpftmp-to-my-a.html) file. It happens in both VS 2017 and VS 2019. I attached a simple single project solution that will reproduce it; just do a **re**build each time. Additionally, the diagnostic build log is attached.

Mark

_This issue has been moved from https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/549296/msbuiilds-fail-from-bc2012-error-cant-open-file-fo.html VSTS ticketId: 857501_ _These are the original issue comments:_ Visual Studio Feedback System on 4/28/2019, 01:51 AM (93 days ago):

We have directed your feedback to the appropriate engineering team for further evaluation. The team will review the feedback and notify you about the next steps.

_These are the original issue solutions:_ (no solutions)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "MSBuilds fail from BC2012 error.. Can't open file for writing: Access to the path … is denied." (#1482)

Issues.Title: Port LocBaml WPF application localization tool to .NET core
Issues.Body:
Transferred from WPF Samples Repo [#85](https://github.com/microsoft/WPF-Samples/issues/85)

he LocBaml tool is now available in the Wpf-Samples repo: https://github.com/Microsoft/WPF-Samples/tree/master/Tools/LocBaml. The current version of the source matches the .NET Framework version, with additional code sanitziation, header updates, and a new SDK-style project file. The tool still needs to be ported to .NET core, and the project file sould be updated to target both netcoreapp3.0 and net472.

Cc: @ryalanms @vatsan-madhavan
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Port LocBaml WPF application localization tool to .NET core" (#1480)

Issues.Title: Thickness should support ctor of all three common ways to create a thickness.
Issues.Body:
Related to https://github.com/dotnet/dotnet-api-docs/pull/2569

Since the ThicknessConverter is one of the most common ways of creating a Thickness object, the Thickness object should support the 3 types of conversion on the ctor.

| | |
| --- | --- |
| `int` | same value for all four sides |
| `int, int` | values for leftright and topbottom |
| `int, int, int, int` | values for each individual side |
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Thickness should support ctor of all three common ways to create a thickness." (#1479)

Issues.Title: Potentially spurious warning  'IsChecked' property not found on 'object' ''RibbonMenuButton' ?
Issues.Body:
It seems like will throw a spurious warning at runtime. I've noticed this and also found it discussed here:

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/10462167/wpf-and-ribboncontrolslibrary-throws-a-bindingexpression-path-error-without-even

My own example is:

System.Windows.Data Warning: 40 : BindingExpression path error: 'IsChecked' property not found on 'object' '' RibbonMenuButton' (Name='NavRotate2DButton')'. BindingExpression:Path=IsChecked; DataItem='RibbonMenuButton' (Name='NavRotate2DButton'); target element is 'RibbonToggleButton' (Name='PART_ToggleButton'); target property is 'NoTarget' (type 'Object')

I'm not use any IsChecked properly with the NavRotate2DButton object in my code.

_This issue has been moved from https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/665487/potentially-spurious-warning-ischecked-property-no.html VSTS ticketId: 956791_ _These are the original issue comments:_ (no comments) _These are the original issue solutions:_ (no solutions)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Potentially spurious warning  'IsChecked' property not found on 'object' ''RibbonMenuButton' ?" (#1473)

Issues.Title: July Update for WPF on .NET Core
Issues.Body:
# July Update for WPF on .NET Core 

Preview 7 was [released last week](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/dotnet/announcing-net-core-3-0-preview-7/) and with that we are now on the final two months before the official release in September. This next month we are planning on open sourcing the final set of managed assemblies and continuing to close all 3.0 bugs. 


Last month we [shared](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/issues/1113) all the great progress from the team and even though Summer is here we've kept fixing bugs and closing on the final set of release work.  Here are a few callouts:

* Improved Visual Studio templates and experience: @jmarolf from the Visual Studio team [added](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/issues/1297) VS support to add WPF Class Library projects and [control library templates](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/1005) and [improve](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/1007) the experience when creating a new WPF .NET Core 3.0 app 
  * This is available in `dotnet new` in the latest core-sdk builds and will become available in Visual Studio 2019 soon. 
* @vatsan-madhavan [Open Sourced](https://github.com/microsoft/WPF-Samples/tree/master/Tools/BamlReflector) our test tool that allows BAML to XAML decompilation.  Check it out! 
* @rladuca fixed behavior changes that derived from missing functionality [#585](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/issues/585) by converting non-seekable PackagePart streams to seekable.  @rladuca also [cleaned up](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/1098) unused source code from PresentationFramework. 
* @arpitmathur [resolved](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/1278) various accessibility issues. 
* @stevenbrix resolved various test failures([1111](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/1111), [1301](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/1301)).
* @ojhad and @vatsan-madhavan finalized all the work related to removing deprecated security features ([1093](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/1093), [1286](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/1286)). 
* @ojhad fixed various crashes ([664](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/issues/664),[579](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/issues/579)) and issues ([1141](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/issues/1141), [848](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/issues/848)).
* @ryalanms fixed a [localization issue](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/1285) and resolved various issues ([1300](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/1300), [1098](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/1098)) related to our build infrastructure. 
* @vatsan-madhavan on-boarded a new [C++ compiler toolset](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/1375) to help with crossgen issues and [enabled SplashScreen build-action](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/pull/1276).


Also, you'll notice a [pinned issue](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/issues/1378) related to providing feedback to the Windows Template Studio Team.  Please review and provide feedback as they are scoping adding WPF project templates to their WTS Visual Studio extension. 

Thank again for your engagement, contributions and feedback. If you have questions, suggestions, or concerns, please let us know.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "July Update for WPF on .NET Core" (#1472)

Issues.Title: A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPF)_WPFAnnotationsStyling_Keyboard: The keyboard users are not able to perform various actions using keyboard
Issues.Body:
Copied from VSO [956777](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_queries/edit/956777/)

Check out Accessibility Insights! - Identify accessibility bugs before check-in and make bug fixing faster and easier.”

Environment Details:
Application Name: .NET Core 3.0 (WPF)


Application version: VS 2019 Preview 4.7.03190

Windows Version: Windows10

ScreenReader Version: Narrator, NVDA 2019.1.1




Pre-requisite:

1) Download the latest .NET Core 3 daily build by going to this link.
2) Install Windows (x86 or x64) versions of sdk listed under Master (3.0.x Runtime) by clicking "Installer" link.


Repro Steps:


1) Run exe file for "AnnotationsStyling" from the build app folder provided.
2) Main Window for "AnnotationsStyling" solution will appear.
3) Start screen reader.
4) Navigate to the contents in the main window.


Actual:

Issue 1:

When keyboard users navigate using the "Tab" key within the main window they are unable to access the "Next Page",  "Decrease Zoom" and "Increase Zoom" buttons.



The same issue is observed using the both the screen readers i.e. Narrator and NVDA.



Issue 2:

When users selects any text content then the user can either highlight it with different colors, remove the color or change the color of the highlighted text, provide a description to a certain text and even can provide link to the text. But these all the actions cannot be performed using keyboard and a mouse user can per these functions.



The same issue is observed using the both the screen readers i.e. Narrator and NVDA.



Expected:

All the actions that a mouse users is able to perform the same action keyboard and screen reader users  should be available to perform using keyboard.




User Impact:

If the screen reader and keyboard users are not able to interact with the interactive elements using the keyboard then they might not be able to perform all the functions as a mouse user is able to access.




Recommendations:

Please refer to below URL which is repository for accessibility bug fixes.

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/msenable/Pages/Home.aspx




MAS Reference:

MAS 1.3.1

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc={54f28d1f-a2d1-4dcd-84e1-5c9b87e8aba4}

MAS 2.1.1

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc={8492c4eb-c179-40ae-8777-cd044ed725a2}
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPF)_WPFAnnotationsStyling_Keyboard: The keyboard users are not able to perform various actions using keyboard" (#1471)

Issues.Title: A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPF)_WPF ControlsAndLayout_Layout Dock panel_ScreenReader: Screen reader focus is not moving in proper logical order.
Issues.Body:
Copied from VSO [956760](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_queries/edit/956760/)

Check out Accessibility Insights! - Identify accessibility bugs before check-in and make bug fixing faster and easier.”

Environment Details:

Application Name: .NET Core 3.0 (WPF)


.NET Core SDK version:  3.0.100-preview8-013442
Windows Version: Windows10


ScreenReader Version: Narrator, NVDA 2019.1.1




Pre-requisite:

1) Download the latest .NET Core 3 daily build by going to this link.
2) Install Windows (x86 or x64) versions of sdk listed under Master (3.0.x Runtime) by clicking "Installer" link.


Repro Steps:

1) Download the latest .NET Core 3 daily build given on .NET Core daily builds page. 
2) Install Windows (x86 or x64) versions of sdk listed under Master (3.0.x Runtime) by clicking "Installer" link.
3) Run exe file for "ControlsAndLayout" from the build app folder provided. 
4) Main Window for "ControlsAndLayout" solution will appear. 
5) From the Sample Library pane under Layout, select "DockPanel". 
6) Turn on screen reader
7) Navigate to main content.

Actual:

Screen reader focus is not moving in proper logical order. i.e. from left to right and then Top to bottom.


Expected:

Screen reader focus should move in proper logical order/


User Impact:

The screen reader user will get confused  for content ordering.




Recommendations:

Please refer to below URL which is repository for accessibility bug fixes.

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/msenable/Pages/Home.aspx




MAS Reference:

MAS 1.3.2:

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc={1ee227a7-e3c5-47b8-ab18-48ca8595077b}
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPF)_WPF ControlsAndLayout_Layout Dock panel_ScreenReader: Screen reader focus is not moving in proper logical order. " (#1470)

Issues.Title: A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPF)_WPFBrush_LinearGradient-InteractiveExample_ScreenReader: screen reader  focus is not going on the text which is inside the Markup expandable group.
Issues.Body:
Copied from VSO [956749](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_queries/edit/956749/)

Check out Accessibility Insights! - Identify accessibility bugs before check-in and make bug fixing faster and easier.”

Environment Details:

Application Name: .NET Core 3.0 WPF


.NET Core SDK version:  3.0.100-preview8-013442
Windows Version: Windows10

Screen Reader Vesion : Narrator, NVDA 2019.1.1





Pre-requisite:

1) Download the latest .NET Core 3 daily build by going to this link.
2) Install Windows (x86 or x64) versions of sdk listed under Master (3.0.x Runtime) by clicking "Installer" link.


Repro Steps:


1) Run exe file for "Brushes" from the build app folder provided.
2) Main Window for "Brush Examples" solution will appear.​
3) Navigate to "Gradient Examples" option from left navigation and hit enter key.​
4) Navigate to "Linear Gradient Brush Example" option and hit enter key.​
5) Navigate to "Interactive Examples" option and hit enter key.  ​
6) Main window for "Interactive Examples" option will appear.
7) Start screen reader.
8) Navigate Markup expandable group


Actual:

Nvda Focus is not going on the text which is inside the Markup expandable group.



Expected:

Screen reader should read the inside text of the Markup expandable group

User Impact:

Screen reader user may not able to access this information.

Recommendations:

Please refer to below URL which is repository for accessibility bug fixes.

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/msenable/Pages/Home.aspx




MAS Reference:

MAS 1.3.1

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc={54f28d1f-a2d1-4dcd-84e1-5c9b87e8aba4}
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPF)_WPFBrush_LinearGradient-InteractiveExample_ScreenReader: screen reader  focus is not going on the text which is inside the Markup expandable group." (#1469)

Issues.Title: A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPF)_WPF ControlsAndLayout_Controls TabControl_Keyboard: Tab get selected when keyboard focus moves from one tab to other.
Issues.Body:
Copied fro,m VSO [956741](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_queries/edit/956741/)

Check out Accessibility Insights! - Identify accessibility bugs before check-in and make bug fixing faster and easier.”

Environment Details:
Application Name: .NET Core 3.0 WPF

.NET Core SDK version:  3.0.100-preview8-013442

Windows Version: Windows10
ScreenReader Version: Narrator, NVDA 2019.1.1




Pre-requisite:

1) Download the latest .NET Core 3 daily build by going to this link.

2) Install Windows (x86 or x64) versions of sdk listed under Master (3.0.x Runtime) by clicking "Installer" link. 


Repro Steps:

1) Open Visual Studio.

2) Hit on File and select Open->Project/Solution.

3) Run exe file for "ControlsAndLayout" from the build app folder provided. 
4)Main Window for "ControlsAndLayout" solution will appear. 
5)From the Sample Library pane under Controls, select "TabControl". 
6) Navigate to any menu item using keyboard.


Actual:

Tab get selected when keyboard focus moves from one tab to other.
Image


Expected:
Only On focus any item should not get selected.



User Impact:

Keyboard only user will get confused while navigating as it is directly get selected.




Recommendations:

Please refer to below URL which is repository for accessibility bug fixes.

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/msenable/Pages/Home.aspx




MAS Reference:

MAS 3.2.1:
https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc={a4bbd37d-ee11-485e-b5c8-0539f0ac94b2}

Issues.Title: A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPF)_WPFConcepts_MenuSample_Screenreader: Screen reader is announcing wrong ordering for the file /edit / Project menuitem
Issues.Body:
Copied from VSO[ 956410](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_queries/edit/956410/)

Check out Accessibility Insights! - Identify accessibility bugs before check-in and make bug fixing faster and easier.”

Environment Details:

Application Name: .NET Core 3.0 WPF


.NET Core SDK version:  3.0.100-preview8-013442
Windows Version: Windows10

Screen Reader Vesion : Narrator, NVDA 2019.1.1





Pre-requisite:

1) Download the latest .NET Core 3 daily build by going to this link.
2) Install Windows (x86 or x64) versions of sdk listed under Master (3.0.x Runtime) by clicking "Installer" link.


Repro Steps:


1) Run exe file for "Concepts" from the build app folder provided. 
2) Main Window for "Concepts" solution will appear. 
3) Select "Samples" tab item. 
4) From right navigation under "Controls" select "Menu Sample". 
5) Navigate to the preview tab and the to "File"/"Edit" menu item.
6) start screen reader and observe the screen reader announcement.

Actual:

Screen reader is announcing wrong ordering for the file /edit / Project menu item.
for example there are four sub menu inside the Edit menu item but screen reader is announcing for first sub menu item as 1 of 5.
Expected:

Screen reader should announce proper ordering for sub menu item.

User Impact:

Screen reader user may get confuse with ordering inside the menuitem.




Recommendations:

Please refer to below URL which is repository for accessibility bug fixes.

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/msenable/Pages/Home.aspx




MAS Reference:

MAS1.3.1

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc={54f28d1f-a2d1-4dcd-84e1-5c9b87e8aba4}
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPF)_WPFConcepts_MenuSample_Screenreader: Screen reader is announcing wrong ordering for the file /edit / Project menuitem " (#1467)

Issues.Title: A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPF )_WPFConcepts_MenuSample_Screenreader: Screen reader is announcing the wrong name of the drop down menu item "Project"
Issues.Body:
Copied from VSO: [956407](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_queries/edit/956407/)
Check out Accessibility Insights! - Identify accessibility bugs before check-in and make bug fixing faster and easier.”

Environment Details:

Application Name: .NET Core 3.0 WPF


.NET Core SDK version:  3.0.100-preview8-013442
Windows Version: Windows10

Screen Reader Vesion : Narrator, NVDA 2019.1.1





Pre-requisite:

1) Download the latest .NET Core 3 daily build by going to this link.
2) Install Windows (x86 or x64) versions of sdk listed under Master (3.0.x Runtime) by clicking "Installer" link.


Repro Steps:


1) Run exe file for "Concepts" from the build app folder provided. 
2) Main Window for "Concepts" solution will appear. 
3) Select "Samples" tab item. 
4) From right navigation under "Controls" select "Menu Sample". 
5) Navigate to the preview tab and the to Project menu item.
6) start screen reader and observe the screen reader announcement.

Actual:

Screen reader is announcing the wrong name of the menu item "Project" and sub menu item inside "Project".

Expected:

Screen reader should announce proper name of the controls.

User Impact:

Screen reader user may not identify the control as name is incorrect.




Recommendations:

Please refer to below URL which is repository for accessibility bug fixes.

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/msenable/Pages/Home.aspx




MAS Reference:

MAS1.3.1

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc={54f28d1f-a2d1-4dcd-84e1-5c9b87e8aba4}
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPF )_WPFConcepts_MenuSample_Screenreader: Screen reader is announcing the wrong name of the drop down menu item "Project"" (#1466)

Issues.Title: A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPF)_WPFConcepts_AnimatePathSample_ScreenReader: Screen reader focus is not going on the text under the first tab
Issues.Body:
Copied from VSO [952376](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_queries/edit/952376/)

Check out Accessibility Insights! - Identify accessibility bugs before check-in and make bug fixing faster and easier.”

Environment Details:


Application Name: .NET Core 3.0 WPF


.NET Core SDK version:  3.0.100-preview8-013442
Windows Version: Windows10

Screen Reader Vesion : Narrator, NVDA 2019.1.1




Pre-requisite:

1) Download the latest .NET Core 3 daily build by going to this link.
2) Install Windows (x86 or x64) versions of sdk listed under Master (3.0.x Runtime) by clicking "Installer" link. 

Repro Steps:


1) Run exe file for "Concepts" from the build app folder provided. 
2) Main Window for "Concepts" solution will appear. 
3) Select "Samples" tab item. 
4) From right navigation under "Animation" select "Animation Path Sample" 
 
 Actual:
 Screen reader focus is not going on the text which is under "Animation Path Sample" tab .
Similar issue is found under preview sample tab.

Same issue is observed through out the application where ever the XML tab is available.

Expected:

Screen reader focus should go on this text and screen reader should read this text properly.



User Impact:

Screen reader user will not get any information inside "Animation path sample"

Recommendations:

Please refer to below URL which is repository for accessibility bug fixes.

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/msenable/Pages/Home.aspx




MAS Reference:

MAS 1.3.1:

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc={54f28d1f-a2d1-4dcd-84e1-5c9b87e8aba4}
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPF)_WPFConcepts_AnimatePathSample_ScreenReader: Screen reader focus is not going on the text under the first tab  " (#1464)

Issues.Title: A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPF)_WPFExpenseItStandAlone_ScreenReader: Narrator does not read the tooltip information for the list of employees.
Issues.Body:
Copied from VSO [951726](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_queries/edit/951726/)

Check out Accessibility Insights! - Identify accessibility bugs before check-in and make bug fixing faster and easier.”

Environment Details:
Application Name: .NET Core 3.0 (WPF)


.NET Core SDK version:  3.0.100-preview8-013442
Windows Version: Windows10

ScreenReader Version: Narrator



Pre-requisite:

1) Download the latest .NET Core 3 daily build by going to this link.
2) Install Windows (x86 or x64) versions of sdk listed under Master (3.0.x Runtime) by clicking "Installer" link. 

Repro Steps:


1) Run exe file for "ExpenseItDemo" from the build app folder provided.
2) Main Window for "ExpenseItDemo" solution will appear. ​
3) Start Narrator and move to list of employees under set of Employees radiobuttons.




Actual:

Narrator does not read the tooltip conveying instruction "Choose Employee Name" along with list of employees.



This issue has been observed only with Narrator and not with NVDA.


Expected:


Narrator should read the tooltip conveying instruction "Choose Employee Name" along with list of employees.


User Impact:

ScreenReader users will not get instruction given in the tooltip which is necessary for creating Expense Report. 



Recommendations:

Please refer to below URL which is repository for accessibility bug fixes.

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/msenable/Pages/Home.aspx




MAS Reference:

MAS 1.3.1

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc={54f28d1f-a2d1-4dcd-84e1-5c9b87e8aba4}
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPF)_WPFExpenseItStandAlone_ScreenReader: Narrator does not read the tooltip information for the list of employees." (#1463)

Issues.Title: A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPF)_WPF ControlsAndLayout_Controls Tooltip_ScreenReader: Screen reader is not announcing tooltip.
Issues.Body:
Copied from VSO: [951723](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_queries/edit/951723/)

Check out Accessibility Insights! - Identify accessibility bugs before check-in and make bug fixing faster and easier.”

Environment Details:
Application Name: .NET Core 3.0 (WPF)

.NET Core SDK version:  3.0.100-preview8-013442

Windows Version: Windows10

ScreenReader Version: Narrator, NVDA 2019.1.1




Pre-requisite:

1) Download the latest .NET Core 3 daily build by going to this link.

2) Install Windows (x86 or x64) versions of sdk listed under Master (3.0.x Runtime) by clicking "Installer" link. 


Repro Steps:

1) Open Visual Studio.

2) Hit on File and select Open->Project/Solution.

3) Run exe file for "ControlsAndLayout" from the build app folder provided. 
4) Main Window for "ControlsAndLayout" solution will appear. 
5) From the Sample Library pane under Controls, select "Tooltip". 
6) Turn on Screen reader.
7) Navigate to Textbox using keyboard.


Actual:

When screen reader focus goes to Textbox, tooltip appears but it is not announced by Screen reader. 



Note: Similar Issue is observed with NVDA



Expected:

Tooltip should be announced by screen reader.




User Impact:

Screen reader users unable to understand about Tooltip information. 




Recommendations:

Please refer to below URL which is repository for accessibility bug fixes.

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/msenable/Pages/Home.aspx




MAS Reference:

MAS 1.1.1

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc={d2d2051f-bdc8-4af7-8e18-38aae867e216}

MAS1.3.1:
https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc={54f28d1f-a2d1-4dcd-84e1-5c9b87e8aba4}
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPF)_WPF ControlsAndLayout_Controls Tooltip_ScreenReader: Screen reader is not announcing tooltip. " (#1462)

Issues.Title: A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPF)_WPFExpenseItStandAlone_ScreenReader: ScreenReader reads repetitive information about the button "Create Expense Report".
Issues.Body:
Copied from VSO [951722](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_queries/edit/951722)

Check out Accessibility Insights! - Identify accessibility bugs before check-in and make bug fixing faster and easier.”

Environment Details:
Application Name: .NET Core 3.0 (WPF)


.NET Core SDK version:  3.0.100-preview8-013442
Windows Version: Windows10

ScreenReader Version: Narrator, NVDA 2019.1.1



Pre-requisite:

1) Download the latest .NET Core 3 daily build by going to this link.
2) Install Windows (x86 or x64) versions of sdk listed under Master (3.0.x Runtime) by clicking "Installer" link. 

Repro Steps:


1) Run exe file for "ExpenseItDemo" from the build app folder provided.
2) Main Window for "ExpenseItDemo" solution will appear. ​
3) Start ScreenReader and move to "Create Expense Report" button.




Actual:

ScreenReader reads repetitive information about the button "Create Expense Report".

It reads the Name, Accelerator key, Help Text values which are all same. 



This issue has been observed both in Narrator and NVDA.


Expected:

ScreenReader should not read repetitive information about the button "Create Expense Report". Tooltip can be removed for the controls with labels. 



User Impact:

ScreenReader users will get repetitive information about the button "Create Expense Report" which can be disgusting while using the application. 




Recommendations:

Please refer to below URL which is repository for accessibility bug fixes.

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/msenable/Pages/Home.aspx




MAS Reference:

MAS 1.3.1

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc={54f28d1f-a2d1-4dcd-84e1-5c9b87e8aba4}

MAS 4.2.1 
https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc={a12f3779-bdf1-40c2-bbcc-0e314ea94858}
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPF)_WPFExpenseItStandAlone_ScreenReader: ScreenReader reads repetitive information about the button "Create Expense Report"." (#1461)

Issues.Title: A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPF)_WPFExpenseItStandAlone_ScreenReader: ScreenReader does not read menuitem shortcut as well as ordering properly under "File" menu.
Issues.Body:
Copied from VSO [951708](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_queries/edit/951708/)

Check out Accessibility Insights! - Identify accessibility bugs before check-in and make bug fixing faster and easier.”

Environment Details:
Application Name: .NET Core 3.0 (WPF)


.NET Core SDK version:  3.0.100-preview8-013442
Windows Version: Windows10

ScreenReader Version: Narrator, NVDA 2019.1.1



Pre-requisite:

1) Download the latest .NET Core 3 daily build by going to this link.
2) Install Windows (x86 or x64) versions of sdk listed under Master (3.0.x Runtime) by clicking "Installer" link. 

Repro Steps:


1) Run exe file for "ExpenseItDemo" from the build app folder provided.
2) Main Window for "ExpenseItDemo" solution will appear. ​
3) Start ScreenReader and move to menu items under "File" menu.




Actual:

Issue 1:

ScreenReader does not read the shortcut written beside the menuitem "Create Expense Report".



Issue 2:

ScreeenReader does not read the correct ordering of the menu items under "File" menu. It reads "Exit" 3/3.



This issue has been observed both in Narrator and NVDA.


Expected:

Issue 1:

ScreenReader should read the shortcut(Cntrl+Shift+C) written beside the menuitem "Create Expense Report".



Issue 2:

ScreeenReader should read the correct ordering of the menu items under "File" menu as 1/2 , 2/2.



User Impact:

ScreenReader users will not be able to obtain information about the shortcut present for the menu item and also will not understand the  total no of items present under the menu.




Recommendations:

Please refer to below URL which is repository for accessibility bug fixes.

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/msenable/Pages/Home.aspx




MAS Reference:

MAS 1.3.1

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc={54f28d1f-a2d1-4dcd-84e1-5c9b87e8aba4}
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPF)_WPFExpenseItStandAlone_ScreenReader: ScreenReader does not read menuitem shortcut as well as ordering properly under "File" menu." (#1460)

Issues.Title: A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPF)_WPF Message Box_ScreenReader: Screen reader is not announcing Expanded State for combobox.
Issues.Body:
Copied from VSO [951013](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_queries/edit/951013/)

Check out Accessibility Insights! - Identify accessibility bugs before check-in and make bug fixing faster and easier.”


Environment Details:
Application Name: .NET Core 3.0 (WPF)

.NET Core SDK version:  3.0.100-preview8-013442

Windows Version: Windows10

Screen Reader Version: Narrator, NVDA 2019.1.1






Pre-requisite:

1) Download the latest .NET Core 3 daily build by going to this link.
2) Install Windows (x86 or x64) versions of sdk listed under Master (3.0.x Runtime) by clicking "Installer" link.


Repro Steps:


1) Open Visual Studio.
2) Hit on File and select Open->Project/Solution.
3) Run exe file for "Message Box" from the build app folder provided.​
4) Main Window for "Message Box" solution will appear.
5) Start screen reader.
8) Navigate to any "Combo box" and Expand it using Alt + Down Arrow key.

Actual:

When we expand any Combo box, Screen reader is not announcing its state that Combo box is Expanded.

It is announcing its collapsed state properly. 



Note: Similar issue is observed with Chrome + NVDA.



Expected:

Screen reader should announce state of every combo box as it is collapsed or expanded properly. 



User Impact:

If proper state of the interactive element is not announced to the screen reader users then will not understand on activating the element some action has taken place for not. 




Recommendations:

Please refer to below URL which is repository for accessibility bug fixes.

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/msenable/Pages/Home.aspx




MAS Reference:

MAS 1.3.1

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc={54f28d1f-a2d1-4dcd-84e1-5c9b87e8aba4}
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPF)_WPF Message Box_ScreenReader: Screen reader is not announcing Expanded State for combobox." (#1459)

Issues.Title: A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPF)_WPF Text Formatting_HighContrast: Button selection is not visible when we apply High contrast Black theme.
Issues.Body:
Copied from VSO [949977](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_queries/edit/949977/)

Check out Accessibility Insights! - Identify accessibility bugs before check-in and make bug fixing faster and easier.”

Environment Details:
Application Name: .NET Core 3.0 (WPF)

.NET Core SDK version:  3.0.100-preview8-013442

Windows Version: Windows10

ScreenReader Version: Narrator, NVDA 2019.1.1




Pre-requisite:

1) Download the latest .NET Core 3 daily build by going to this link.

2) Install Windows (x86 or x64) versions of sdk listed under Master (3.0.x Runtime) by clicking "Installer" link. 


Repro Steps:

1) Open Visual Studio.

2) Hit on File and select Open->Project/Solution.

3) Run exe file for "Text Formatting" from the build app folder provided.
4) Main Window for "Text Formatting" solution will appear.
5) Select some buttons Bold and Italic 
6) Apply High contrast Black




Actual:

When we select some text formatting options like Bold, Italic buttons, It is visible in normal mode

But in High contrast black theme we are unable to se the selection. 





Expected:

All content available on screen should be clearly visible in high contrast mode. 




User Impact:

Low vision users will face difficulties for accessing screen in High contrast theme. 




Recommendations:

Please refer to below URL which is repository for accessibility bug fixes.

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/msenable/Pages/Home.aspx




MAS Reference:

MAS 1.4.3

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc={a73546c7-765f-489c-b18f-afb659fe99e6}
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPF)_WPF Text Formatting_HighContrast: Button selection is not visible when we apply High contrast Black theme.  " (#1458)

Issues.Title: A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPF)_WPFBrush_LinearGradient-InteractiveExample_AI4D: (Brushes/button '') An onscreen element must not have a null BoundingRectangle property.
Issues.Body:
Copied from VSO: [949047](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_queries/edit/949047/)

Application: Brushes has the following accessibility issue that needs investigation.

Issue Details
If the element is offscreen, set its IsOffscreen property to TRUE. If the element is onscreen, provide a BoundingRectangle property.

Element path: button ''

To Reproduce and How to Fix guidance: Please open the attached Accessibility Insights for Windows Test File (*.a11ytest) to reproduce the error in Accessibility Insights for Windows.

This accessibility issue was found using Accessibility Insights for Windows, a tool that helps debug and find accessibility issues earlier. Get more information & download this tool at https://aka.ms/AccessibilityInsights.

screenshot
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49078227/62074414-99fc5480-b1f7-11e9-9dbb-35ad40da35c0.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPF)_WPFBrush_LinearGradient-InteractiveExample_AI4D: (Brushes/button '') An onscreen element must not have a null BoundingRectangle property." (#1457)

Issues.Title: A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPF)_WPFBrush_Contents_ScreenReader: Using narrator the expand/collapse state not announced for the "Contents" button for screen reader users.der user.
Issues.Body:
Copied from VSO [948255](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_queries/edit/948255)

Check out Accessibility Insights! - Identify accessibility bugs before check-in and make bug fixing faster and easier.”

Environment Details:
Application Name: .NET Core 3.0 (WPF and ASP.NET Core)


Application version: VS 2019 Preview 4.7.03190

Windows Version: Windows10

ScreenReader Version: Narrator, NVDA 2019.1.1




Pre-requisite:

1) Download the latest .NET Core 3 daily build by going to this link.
2) Install Windows (x86 or x64) versions of sdk listed under Master (3.0.x Runtime) by clicking "Installer" link.


Repro Steps:


1) Open Visual Studio.
2) Hit on File and select Open->Project/Solution.
3) Select the "Brushes" solution and open it. 
4) From the Solution Explorer, right click on the file under the solution "Brushes".
5) Select "Debug" and hit "Start new Instance".
6) Main Window for "Brush Examples" solution will appear.
7) Start screen reader.
8) Navigate to "Contents" section and listen if the expand/collapse state is announced properly.




Actual:

Using narrator when screen reader users navigate to the "Contents" section first "Contents grouping collapsed" is announced and then the "Contents" button is announced. The expand/collapse action takes place on activating the "Content" button but the state here is not announced to the screen reader users.




Same issue is observed in the below scenario:

1) Linear Gradient - Interactive Example - The expand/collapse action takes place on activating the "Markup" button but the state here is not announced to the screen reader users.



Expected:

The proper expand/collapse state should be announced on the "Content" button so that when screen reader user activates the button element it should inform then that whether some content has expanded or collapsed. 




User Impact:

If proper state of the interactive element is not announced to the screen reader users then will not understand on activating the element some action has taken place for not. 




Recommendations:

Please refer to below URL which is repository for accessibility bug fixes.

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/teams/msenable/Pages/Home.aspx




MAS Reference:

MAS 1.3.1

https://microsoft.sharepoint.com/:w:/r/teams/msenable/_layouts/15/WopiFrame.aspx?sourcedoc={54f28d1f-a2d1-4dcd-84e1-5c9b87e8aba4}
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "A11y_.NETCore3.0(WPF)_WPFBrush_Contents_ScreenReader: Using narrator the expand/collapse state not announced for the "Contents" button for screen reader users.der user." (#1456)
